intro: Linanthus longitubus, commonly known as the long-tube linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Evening Primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Linanthus longitubus typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its unique floral structure and pollination mechanisms make it an interesting subject for ecological studies.
